About.description: Software Engineer with 1.5 years of professional experience in Java and Liferay, specialized in developing custom web portals and backend services. I have hands-on experience in designing, implementing, and optimizing portlets, REST APIs, and microservices, working with technologies such as Java, JSP, React, HTML/CSS, Docker, and relational and non-relational databases. I have also worked with cloud platforms like AWS and Azure, designing and deploying scalable and efficient solutions tailored to project needs. During my internships, I gained additional experience with Spring (Spring Boot), developing backend services and distributed APIs. Currently, I focus on backend web development and Liferay portals, integrating services and optimizing user experience. I’m passionate about designing efficient and scalable systems, applying best practices, automation, and software quality principles, and participating in projects that involve complex technical challenges.

resp1.text: Development and maintenance of custom portlets in Liferay 7.4, as well as implementation of tailored solutions to improve performance and user experience in Liferay DXP environments

resp2.text: Active participation in Liferay version migration processes and continuous improvement of portal functionalities through development best practices

resp3.text: Use of technologies such as Java, JSP, HTML/CSS, JavaScript, React, ServiceBuilder, RestBuilder, ElasticSearch, indexer, custom fragments and templates, along with the implementation of REST APIs using Swagger/OpenAPI

resp1.text: Design, development, and maintenance of backend services using Java with Spring Boot, applying design patterns and architectural best practices

resp2.text: Creation and documentation of RESTful APIs using Swagger. Data persistence in both relational (SQL) and NoSQL databases

resp3.text: Development of unit and integration tests to ensure code quality and stability

resp4.text: Continuous training in microservices architecture, DevOps, and event-driven systems such as Kafka

resp5.text: Integration of Kafka and Firebase for service communication, and application monitoring with Prometheus and Grafana

detail2.text: Completed the degree in 4 years, passing all subjects on the first attempt (with 3 academic honors, 11 outstanding, and 18 notable)

detail3.text: Honors: Waves and Electromagnetism, Statistics, and Computability

detail4.text: I also scored a 10 in my Final Degree Project (TFG), titled 'Web Platform for Academic Work Coordination'

detail5.text: Recognition awarded by the Indra Chair and the University of Oviedo for the best Final Degree Thesis in the year 2023/2024
